title: Babs' School Election
description: Babs is running for President of her college's freshman class. Riley attempts to provide unwanted assistance to her election campaign meet with predictable disaster.

title: Riley's Gift from the Boss
description: Riley receives a letter from the president of the airplane plant in which he works, Cyrus P. Cunningham, announcing that the company will honor Riley's ten years of service with a luncheon in the boardroom the following day. Excited, Riley dragoons his pal Gillis into checking out the boardroom during their lunch hour, and Riley comes across a piece of paper that says "Riley -- Gift -- CAR." The entire Riley family rejoices at the prospect of receiving a car from the boss. The next day, Riley is deflated when he learns that his gift is considerably less grand than an automobile. He spends the rest of the week trying without success to bring himself to tell Peg and the kids that they will be riding the bus for some time to come. (The Paley Center for Media)

title: Riley's New Suit
description: Riley needs a new suit. When his kids decide to surprise him with one, he begins thinking he's crazy because the only suit he has to use keeps disappearing.

title: The Cake Contest
description: Riley replaces Peg's baking-contest entry with a store-bought cake.

title: Riley's Kiss in the Dark
description: Riley tries determining the identity of a woman who kissed him in the dark.

title: Riley Proves His Manhood
description: Peg goes to work in a run-down caf√©.

title: Riley's Sister Cissy
description: Riley makes a last-ditch attempt to marry off his sister Cissy.

title: Riley and the Bear Contest
description: Riley goes all out to win a car in a bean-counting contest.

title: Riley the Scoutmaster
description: Riley sets up as Scoutmaster when Junior's regular scoutmaster must take a leave of absence for the troop. Also, Riley sets out to show his wife that a man can do all the household duties in half the time a woman can.

title: Riley Invades the Fight Game
description: Riley is pitted against boxer Lou Nova at a charity bazaar.

title: Riley's Lost Weekend
description: The Rileys swap houses with "Square Head" Malloy for three days.

title: Junior Wins the Soapbox Derby
description: Junior's efforts to build a racer are hampered by unwanted advice.

title: Riley's Family Reunion
description: Riley's family is selected to appear in a radio program that brings parents and a child together for a family reunion - and plants hidden microphones throughout the house to capture their unrehearsed reactions to the event.

title: Riley's Business Venture
description: Riley tries supplementing his wages by buying a hamburger stand.

title: Riley Camps Out
description: Feeling that their families don't sufficiently appreciate them, Riley and Gillis decide to spend their vacation camping at a remote mountain cabin - and come to appreciate their lives back in the suburbs.

title: Riley Steps Out
description: Riley picks up two banquet tickets discarded by his boss.

title: Riley's Operation
description: Riley's sore throat is traced to his tonsils and he's ordered to have them removed. It's all his family and friends can do to get him to the hospital for his operation.

title: Riley the Executive Type
description: Riley is dismayed when his spur-of-the-moment resignation is accepted.

title: Riley Engages an Escort
description: Riley's efforts to secure a date for Babs backfire.

title: Riley Cultivates Babs
description: When Babs' friends see her out with Riley, rumors fly that she's dating a rich older man.

title: Riley's Uncle Baxter
description: Peg's uncle captivates the Rileys with stories of his war heroism.

title: Riley Outwits Cupid
description: Riley tries dissuading Babs from going steady.

title: Riley Gets Engaged
description: Riley tries dissuading Babs from going steady.

title: Riley Punishes Junior
description: Riley is named Father of the Month by his lodge.

title: Riley Meets a Rival
description: Hoping to make Riley jealous, Peg invites an old flame for dinner.

title: Riley the Typical Worker
description: Hoping to make Riley jealous, Peg invites an old flame for dinner.

title: Riley's Surprise Package
description: Riley's jealous nature backfires on him.

title: Riley and the Boss' Niece
description: Riley is a bundle of nerves, after he promises his boss, Mr. Cunningham, that he'll get a football player to escort his big homely niece to the school dance.

title: Riley and the Beaux Arts Ball
Junior's Secret
description: Junior and Egbert plot to buy a boat, but Riley and Gillis misunderstand and think they are planning to get married.

title: Riley in the Wild Blue Yonder
Babs and Junior Try Home Economics
Look Peg, I'm Dancing
description: Once a year Riley and his pal give their wives a treat by taking them dancing -- but this year the girls insist the guys take dancing lessons first.

title: The Famous Chester A. Riley, Junior
Babs's Wedding
description: It's Babs' wedding day and its hard to tell who's more nervous - Chester A. Riley or his daughter, the bride.

title: The Tree That Grew in Brooklyn
Friends Are Where You Find Them
description: Furious with one another after arguing, best friends Riley and Gillis compete to meet other people and make new friends.

title: Riley Hires a Nurse
description: With Babs expecting, Chester decides to become involved in planning day-care for his soon-to-be-grandchild. However, when he attends a "baby nursing course" that he thought would be for nurses, he discovers that it is instead a class for mothers. Complications ensue.

title: Babs's Dream House
description: Babs tells Peg that she and her husband have hired a famous architect to design their new home. Riley isn't convinced that the designer knows his business and soon the two men are butting heads over the project's blueprints.

title: Vacation Plans
description: When Riley is furlough temporarily from his job, he decides to surprise the family and take them on a spring vacation, but Peg, Babs and Junior aren't too keen on the prospect.
